com.newmainsoftech.spray.sprex.web.servlet.config

Class ViewResolverDefinitionInjector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.newmainsoftech.spray.sprex.web.servlet.config.ViewResolverDefinitionInjector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ViewResolverDefinitionInjectorCase, org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextAware

    public class ViewResolverDefinitionInjector
extends Object
implements org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextAware, ViewResolverDefinitionInjectorCase
    Default implementation of ViewResolverDefinitionInjectorCase interface to adds view resolver beans to application context.
    This is developed due to that BeanDefinitionRegistryPostProcessor and PostConstruct does not work (broken) with @Configuration of Spring' JavaConfig (but BeanFactoryPostProcessor.) For more info regarding this issue, refer to
    • https://jira.springsource.org/browse/SPR-8269
    • http://forum.springsource.org/showthread.php?56712-PostConstruct-and-PreDestroy-in-JavaConfig
    • https://jira.springsource.org/browse/SPR-7868
    • http://forum.springsource.org/showthread.php?56712-PostConstruct-and-PreDestroy-in-JavaConfig
    This implementation add the following view resolver beans:
    • BeanNameViewResolver bean
      Adding BeanNameViewResolver bean by default because, as nature of JavaConfig, BeanNameViewResolver became to make more sense than XML config era.
      Although, please be advised that BeanNameViewResolver itself is not aware of i18n support - thereby, it must be done by view level or controller level.
    • XmlViewResolver bean
      Adds XmlViewResolver bean only when view XML file exists. For more info, refer to ViewResolverDefinitionInjector class.
    If those do not fit to your preference, then override the following methods (from ViewResolverDefinitionInjectorCase interface:
    • addViewResolverDefinition()
    • addViewResolverDefinition(BeanDefinitionRegistry)
    Author:
    Arata.Y

      • getViewXmlLocation

        public String getViewXmlLocation()
        To retrieve class path string pointing view definition XML file to construct a Resource object being given to XmlViewResolver.setLocation method.
        Returns:
        Class path of view definition xml file being used by XmlViewResolver bean.
        Default location is obtained from DefaultViewXmlLocation.
